sentences.cn: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

sentences.en: All of this was small stuff compared to Renaissance Center.
sentences.cn: 所有这一切比起文艺复兴中心的问题来,还是小巫见大巫.

sentences.en: He was a child of the Renaissance.
sentences.cn: 他是文艺复兴时期的人.

sentences.en: Popular art is experiencing a renaissance.
Sam Hawthorne , in the jargon of the times, was a Renaissance man.
sentences.cn: 萨姆·霍桑这个人,用当时的一句时髦话说, 是个有着文艺复兴时期风格的人.

sentences.en: Science took a new and different turn in the Renaissance.
sentences.cn: 科学在文艺复兴时期发生了新的转变。

sentences.en: Some excerpts from a Renaissance mass are spatchcocked into Gluck's pallid Don Juan music.
sentences.cn: 一些文艺复光时期的弥撒的选节被不适当地加入到了格鲁克平淡无味的唐璜音乐中.

sentences.en: Some of the Renaissance buildings are gorgeous.
sentences.cn: 一些文艺复兴时期的建筑美得令人惊叹。

sentences.en: The EEC further stimulate the renaissance of Western Europe.
sentences.cn: 这一共同体进一步刺激了西欧的复兴.

sentences.en: The fine arts revived during the Renaissance.
sentences.cn: 在文艺复兴时期美术复兴了.

sentences.en: The Italian Renaissance blossomed and this was by no means impossible.
sentences.cn: 意大利文艺复兴欣欣向荣,这绝不是不可能的.

sentences.en: The Renaissance artists were universal men.
sentences.cn: 文艺复兴时期的艺术家们是无所不知的.

sentences.en: The Renaissance was an important chapter in European history.
sentences.cn: 文艺复兴是欧洲历史上的重要时期.

sentences.en: The theme of the conference is renaissance Europe.
sentences.cn: 大会的主题是文艺复兴时期的欧洲。

sentences.en: There are probably fewer hard facts about the life of Henry Purcell than that of any other great composer since the Renaissance.
sentences.cn: 有关亨利·普赛尔生平的可靠资料可能比任何其他文艺复兴以来的伟大作曲家都要少。

phrases.tran_cn: [建]早期文艺复兴的艺术风格；文艺复兴初期（1378-1500）
n. 文艺复兴时期的人文主义
n. 文艺复兴人；多才多艺的人

trans.tran_cn: 文艺复兴（时期），复活，复燃
trans.tran_en: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period
